No, they make minor tweaks to the existing design because it is very expensive and risky to develop VSLI circuits.  In addition, they are giving the Chinese chip fab the opportunity and experience for fabricating advanced integrated circuits.  If the Chinese could manufacture advanced VLSI products, they wouldn't be relying heavily on the Taiwanese Semiconductor Company.  That could be said of America as well.  The CHIP subsidiary is a good start, but we have a long ways to go before weening ourselves off of foreign chip manufacturers.
